issues.title: Compiling krane's scml output does not produce same-looking animation
issues.body:
I've (re-)made a trivial animation project for [the freezer](http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=346962876) - just 2 textures, 1 for each animation of "open" and "closed": [freezer.zip](https://github.com/nsimplex/ktools/files/1014898/freezer.zip)
![screen shot 2017-05-19 at 18 39 14](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16622343/26257868/812aa4cc-3cc2-11e7-8be6-57ff2d775d22.png)

The images have a large transparent area around them - after compiling with scml, decompiling [the result](https://github.com/nsimplex/ktools/files/1014929/freezer.zip) with krane, the sprite's opaque part appears to have stretched into the size of the original image. This is also visible when opening krane's output in Spriter:
![screen shot 2017-05-19 at 18 27 51](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16622343/26257431/ec10d326-3cc0-11e7-9995-4e384466719e.png)
This is then also visible in the game, after compiling krane's output with scml.

issues.title: ./configure doesn't detect imagemagick 7
issues.body:
macOS 10.12.4
imagemagick installed from brew. Ironically, the version is even detected by the configure script!

$ ./configure 
-- Detected CPU: sandy-bridge
CMake Error at /usr/local/Cellar/cmake/3.8.1/share/cmake/Modules/FindPackageHandleStandardArgs.cmake:137 (message):
  Could NOT find ImageMagick (missing: ImageMagick_Magick++_LIBRARY
  ImageMagick_MagickWand_LIBRARY ImageMagick_MagickCore_LIBRARY) (found
  version "7.0.5-6")
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  /usr/local/Cellar/cmake/3.8.1/share/cmake/Modules/FindPackageHandleStandardArgs.cmake:377 (_FPHSA_FAILURE_MESSAGE)
  /usr/local/Cellar/cmake/3.8.1/share/cmake/Modules/FindImageMagick.cmake:256 (FIND_PACKAGE_HANDLE_STANDARD_ARGS)
  CMakeLists.txt:60 (FIND_PACKAGE)


-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
See also "/tmp/ktools-master/CMakeFiles/CMakeOutput.log".

issues.title: ktech: Alpha channel issue
issues.body:
There seems to be an issue with images containing low alpha channel values.

Running: 
`$ ktech transparency_test.{png,tex} && ktech transparency_test.tex{,.png}` 
on this image:
 ![transparency_test](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/917394/18397902/9b2a04a8-76ca-11e6-8304-35f966923a9e.png)
results in this image: 
![transparency_test tex](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/917394/18397903/9c39dd64-76ca-11e6-9253-089bf903c339.png)

commit.message: Better numerical stability for low anim scales
Added support for animations with 5+ sides.
Made duplicate anims a warning instead of an error.

4.3.0 release

Fixed a bug due to matrix non-commutativity which was causing many, if
not most, animations to be decompiled incorrectly.
better error handling in atlas creation

Fixed silly win32 atlas bugs. Cause: some files were not being opened in
binary mode.
bugfix with default png extension no longer being added in ktech
fixed issue with mipmap generation causing black squares to appear ingame with some graphic cards
avoid warnings about the hot attribute in older GCC versions
a bit more generic OS checks
better handling of legacy builds and anims
Fixed legacy support in ktech; added legacy build support to krane.
no longer shortening anim duration by one frame

Fixed clipping mask bug; better matrix decomposition; better grouping of
related frame elements into a single timeline.
more fault tolerance; ability to read PNGs directly
fixed bug in multiple input file handling
added an install target to krane
Basic command line interface; support for builds with multiple atlases.
ACTUAL proper handling of animations within banks by their full name
proper handling of animations within banks by their full name
cleaned up the scml.cpp code after the fixes
core functionality done; build/anims are properly converted bidirectionally
fixed bug with image cross referencing
core functionality done, except for the mod tools screwing up the pivots
mathy stuff to prevent jump discontinuities in animations and to impose uniqueness on matrix decomposition
fixed scaling issues on reconverting to the binary format using the mod tools
the scml code is currently quite messy due to all the hacking to fix it, but everything is being converted (scales when converting back to the game are off, though)
template metaprogramming tools for type safety; fixed type safety issues
fixed positioning issues in build symbol positioning; animations are still not exported properly
Something has been achieved. Just don't ask me what.
atlas slicing per animation symbol frame
Added pugixml, reorganized common code into a static lib
Added a notice to the README
fixed noise issue with ktech (really this time... I think)
reorganized source into common/, ktech/ and kraze/
Added a dummy configure script for convenience
fixed image resizing bug (aspect ratio was always preserved); added the --extend option.
Updated the README, improved the Maybe functor and polished the output.
Included files for cross-platformness in the distribution
Version 2.0: full support for the TextureConverter features.

issue_comments.body: One thing that would be nice in order to get versioning is if you would tag releases with `git tag -fam "Release x.y.z" x.y.z` (or -fsm for pgp-signed) :) But that's not really necessary
The blog post linked is dead. Please provide the terminal output as well as sample files showcasing the issue and I'll reopen the issue.

I really appreciate the PKGBUILD, and not only because I'm an Arch Linux user myself. I've tagged the latest release, 4.3.0, which also includes important bugfixes.

Though, since this isn't quite an 'issue', I'm closing it.
You should consider using `#` for **ktech** and **krane** as well

If you want this please register on [PyPI](https://pypi.python.org/pypi) and write me an email.
I will give the ownership of ktools on PyPI to you when you register.

Make a script?

I was wondering if this would be useful to point at the game's directory and have it work automatically.  That would provide a lot of convenience, and seems to me to be a common enough use case.
Have you been able to find a solution for this? I'm having the same problem and I can't figure anything out.  If not, I'll keep working on it as well and hopefully something'll work soon.

Okay I think I just figured something out.  I went [here](https://gist.github.com/JagdeepSingh/4b03cbeab16cc0bc729bbc6d275402d3) to install an older version of ImageMagick with Homebrew and I haven't tried the tools yet, but after running the `./configure && make` it worked just fine and no errors.
@darthmars97: ImageMagick v6 is also available in homebrew, as package `imagemagick@6`
